head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Britain: Terrorism Suspect On The Run

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Britain: Terrorism Suspect On The Run

abstract.p: British government says unidentified terrorism suspect flees after being served with control order, form of house arrest, that requires him to report daily to police, surrender travel documents and reside at address known to authorities; says man is not seen as direct threat to public (S)

block.p: The government said a terrorism suspect had absconded after being served with what is known as a control order, a form of house arrest that would require him to report daily to the police, surrender his travel documents and reside at an address known to the authorities. The man was not identified by name, but John Reid, the home secretary, said he ''had recently been radicalized and wanted to travel abroad for terrorism-related purposes.'' Mr. Reid said the man was not seen as ''a direct threat to the public in the United Kingdom.''
